subject: Learning
title: Explicit vs Implicit Memory
description: One-minute skill: Explicit vs Implicit Memory.

hook.text: You can't explain how you ride a bike, but your body remembers perfectly.

buildup.text: Explicit memory is what you consciously recall: facts, events, names.

discovery.text: Implicit memory works below awarenessâ€”habits, motor skills, conditioned responses.

twist.text: Patients with amnesia lose explicit memory but keep implicit. They learn new skills without knowing it.

climax.text: Your brain runs two memory systems in parallel, often without you realizing.

punchline.text: You remember more than you know you remember.

quiz.question: Which type of memory controls learned motor skills?
